tools.name: iCVMapp3r

tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application that executes the minimal preprocessing pipelines developed by the Human Connectome Project on BIDS-formatted data.

tools.name: BIDS App: MRtrix3_connectome
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for generating structural connectomes using MRtrix3
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application that generates subject connectomes from raw diffusion-weighted MRI data using the MRtrix3 software package, including inter-subject connection density normalisation.

tools.name: BIDS App: SPM
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App containing the Statistical Parametric Mapping (SPM) software
tools.detailed_description: A containerized version of SPM (Statistical Parametric Mapping) designed to run on BIDS datasets. It provides a standardized environment for SPM-based neuroimaging analysis.

tools.name: BIDS App: Baracus

tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application that predicts brain age from FreeSurfer 5.3 output data. It wraps the Baracus model for easy deployment on BIDS datasets.

tools.name: BIDS App: FreeSurfer

tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application that runs the FreeSurfer `recon-all` pipeline on BIDS-formatted structural MRI data to generate cortical surface reconstructions and segmentations.

tools.name: giga_connectome
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate connectomes from fMRIPrep outputs
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App designed to generate functional connectomes from preprocessed fMRI data (specifically fMRIPrep outputs), facilitating large-scale connectome analysis.

tools.name: BIDS App: ndmg
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for NeuroData's MRI to Graphs (ndmg) pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application wrapping the ndmg pipeline, which processes MRI data to generate connectomes (graphs) for analysis.

tools.name: BIDS App: NIAK
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for the Neuroimaging Analysis Kit (NIAK)
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application for NIAK, a pipeline for preprocessing and analysis of fMRI and structural MRI scans, typically used in Octave/MATLAB environments.

tools.name: nipypelines
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for preprocessing functional tasks
tools.detailed_description: A tool to preprocess functional MRI tasks in a BIDS dataset, leveraging Nipype interfaces.

tools.name: OPPNI
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization of Preprocessing Pipelines for NeuroImaging
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App that runs fast optimization of preprocessing pipelines for BOLD fMRI, helping to select the best processing steps for a given dataset.

tools.name: rs_signal_extract
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for resting state signal extraction
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS Application that uses nilearn to extract signals from resting-state fMRI data, facilitating functional connectivity analysis.

tools.name: Brainlife App: FreeSurfer

tools.detailed_description: A Brainlife.io application that wraps FreeSurfer to segment T1w anatomical data into functionally different parts of the brain.

tools.name: Brainlife App: MRtrix3 ACT

tools.detailed_description: A Brainlife.io application that runs MRtrix3 ACT (Anatomically Constrained Tractography) using diffusion-weighted MRI data.

tools.name: calcSulc

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for calculating sulcal morphology (width, depth, etc.) from FreeSurfer surface files, facilitating morphometric analysis in neuroimaging.

tools.name: QuPath Extension Braian

tools.name: Liston Laboratory MultiEcho fMRI Pipeline

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox providing a comprehensive set of measures and algorithms for characterizing brain connectivity, including segregation, integration, and centrality metrics. (Mirror/Distribution for Brainlife)

tools.name: BRAPH 2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive software package for brain connectivity analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: BRAPH 2.0 is a MATLAB-based software package for graph theoretical analysis of brain connectivity. It supports various data modalities (MRI, fMRI, PET, EEG) and provides a GUI for pipeline management and visualization.

tools.name: Brian 2
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for spiking neural networks
tools.detailed_description: Brian 2 is a simulator for spiking neural networks, designed to be easy to learn and use while remaining highly flexible and extensible. It allows users to define models using standard mathematical notation.

tools.name: brian2cuda
tools.one_line_profile: GPU acceleration extension for Brian 2 simulator
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the Brian 2 simulator that enables the simulation of spiking neural networks on NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA, significantly accelerating large-scale models.

tools.name: GraphSim
tools.one_line_profile: Graph similarity algorithms library based on NetworkX
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing various graph similarity algorithms (e.g., SimRank, HITS) built on top of NetworkX, useful for network analysis tasks.

tools.name: CanlabCore
tools.one_line_profile: Core object-oriented tools for neuroimaging analysis in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: The core toolbox for the Canlab neuroimaging analysis suite, providing object-oriented structures for handling fMRI/PET data, statistical analysis, and visualization.

tools.name: CATMAID
tools.one_line_profile: Collaborative Annotation Toolkit for Massive Amounts of Image Data
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for collaborative annotation and tracing of neuronal structures in large-scale biological image data (e.g., EM connectomics).

tools.name: cluster_roi

tools.name: meggie

tools.name: neuPrintExplorer

tools.detailed_description: A web application for exploring and visualizing connectomic data stored in neuPrint databases, facilitating the analysis of neuronal circuits.

tools.name: cluster_tools

tools.detailed_description: A library for running distributed segmentation workflows on biological image data, supporting various cluster environments.

tools.name: brainGraph

tools.name: ArteryNetwork
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for extracting and analyzing brain artery networks from MRI
tools.detailed_description: ArteryNetwork is a pipeline designed to extract vessel structures from Magnetic Resonance Images (MRI) and perform network analysis. It is specifically tailored for tracking adaptation and compensation processes in brain arterial networks, such as in patients with glioblastoma.

tools.name: mneflow
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for EEG/MEG decoding using MNE-Python and TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: mneflow is a Python library that provides a bridge between MNE-Python and TensorFlow for deep learning analysis of EEG and MEG data. It facilitates the development and training of neural networks for decoding cognitive states and processing neurophysiological signals.

tools.name: spm1d
tools.one_line_profile: One-Dimensional Statistical Parametric Mapping in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for one-dimensional Statistical Parametric Mapping (SPM), commonly used in biomechanics and neuroimaging to analyze 1D continuum data (e.g., kinematic trajectories, force curves) using random field theory.

tools.name: spm1dmatlab
tools.one_line_profile: One-Dimensional Statistical Parametric Mapping in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: The MATLAB implementation of spm1d, providing tools for Statistical Parametric Mapping on one-dimensional continuous data, facilitating hypothesis testing on smooth continuum processes.

tools.name: PyBASC
tools.one_line_profile: Bootstrapped Analysis of Stable Clusters for fMRI parcellation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for Bootstrapped Analysis of Stable Clusters (BASC), a semi-automated technique for individual and group-level functional parcellation of fMRI data, ensuring stability and reproducibility of brain regions.

tools.name: pyrsa
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library dedicated to Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA), a computational technique in neuroscience to characterize the geometry of representations in the brain and compare them between models and data.

tools.name: CoSMoMVPA
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Multivariate Pattern Analysis (MVPA) toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB/Octave toolbox for Multivariate Pattern Analysis (MVPA) in neuroimaging, supporting fMRI, MEG, and EEG data. It provides a unified framework for classification, representational similarity analysis, and searchlight analysis.

tools.name: ECPL-ICM&M-Control
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time interferometric measurement and control for photopolymer additive manufacturing
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based platform for real-time measurement and feedback control of Exposure Controlled Projection Lithography (ECPL) systems using interferometry. It handles data acquisition, image analysis, and process control for additive manufacturing.

tools.name: rustDTW
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-threaded Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) implementation
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Python extension backed by Rust for Dynamic Time Warping (DTW), a key algorithm for measuring similarity between temporal sequences in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: PeSCAR
tools.one_line_profile: Permutation Statistics for ROI Connectivity Analysis in EEG/MEG
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for performing Permutation Statistics for Regions of Interest Connectivity (PSRC) analysis, specifically designed for statistical inference on EEG and MEG connectivity data.

tools.name: SNPmatch
tools.one_line_profile: Genotype identification from population sequencing data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to identify the most likely strain or genotype of a sample from a population database using low-coverage sequencing data, commonly used in plant genetics (e.g., Arabidopsis).

tools.name: N-GSBSS
tools.one_line_profile: Improved Gray Matter Surface based Spatial Statistics
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing N-GSBSS, a method for performing spatial statistics on gray matter surfaces in neuroimaging studies, offering improvements over traditional voxel-based morphometry.

tools.name: BrainStat
tools.one_line_profile: Statistics and context decoding toolbox for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python/MATLAB toolbox for statistical analysis of neuroimaging data (surface and volume) and context decoding (meta-analytic interpretation), supporting linear models and nonparametric tests.

tools.name: FCEst
tools.one_line_profile: Methods for estimating time-varying functional connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing methods for estimating Time-Varying Functional Connectivity (TVFC) in neuroimaging data, useful for analyzing dynamic brain states.

tools.name: PALM
tools.one_line_profile: NLP Large-scale Pretraining and Multi-task Learning Framework
tools.detailed_description: A flexible framework for Natural Language Processing (NLP) large-scale pretraining and multi-task learning, applicable to scientific text mining and language modeling tasks.

tools.name: VGLCM-TOP-3D
tools.one_line_profile: Voxel-wise 3D Texture Analysis for MRI
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of Voxel-Based Texture Analysis using Gray Level Co-occurrence Matrices (GLCM) for 3D MRI images, enabling the extraction of texture features from brain scans.

tools.name: princeton-mvpa-toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: The Princeton Multi-Voxel Pattern Analysis Toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A classic MATLAB toolbox for Multi-Voxel Pattern Analysis (MVPA) of fMRI data, providing tools for training and testing classifiers on neural data.

tools.name: PyMVPA
tools.one_line_profile: MultiVariate Pattern Analysis in Python
tools.detailed_description: A robust Python framework for multivariate pattern analysis of neural data (fMRI, EEG, MEG), offering a wide range of algorithms for classification, regression, and feature selection.

tools.name: SnPM
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical NonParametric Mapping toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for Statistical NonParametric Mapping (SnPM), providing permutation-based statistical inference for neuroimaging data (PET, fMRI, EEG/MEG) as an alternative to parametric SPM.

tools.name: SOMOSPIE
tools.one_line_profile: Soil Moisture Spatial Inference Engine
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning-based tool for processing coarse-grained soil moisture data, performing gap-filling, and generating fine-grained predictions across geographic regions.

tools.name: frrsa
tools.one_line_profile: Feature-reweighted representational similarity analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to conduct feature-reweighted representational similarity analysis (FR-RSA) for neuroimaging data, enhancing the sensitivity of standard RSA.

tools.name: PALM (Earthquake)
tools.one_line_profile: Earthquake detection and location architecture
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning based architecture for continuous seismograms processing, including phase picking, association, location, and matched filter for earthquake detection.

tools.name: NeuroRA
tools.one_line_profile: Multimode neural data representation analysis toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolbox for representational analysis in neuroscience, supporting Neural Pattern Similarity (NPS), Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA), Spatiotemporal Pattern Similarity (STPS), and Inter-Subject Correlation (ISC) for fMRI, EEG, and MEG data.

tools.name: PyCTRSA
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-temporal RSA decoding toolbox for EEG/MEG
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox specifically designed for Cross-Temporal Representational Similarity Analysis (CT-RSA) based decoding on temporally resolved neural data like EEG and MEG.

tools.name: palmerpenguins
tools.one_line_profile: Standard dataset for data exploration and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A dataset package providing data for penguins in the Palmer Archipelago, widely used as a modern alternative to the Iris dataset for demonstrating data exploration and visualization techniques in R.

tools.name: PCNtoolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Normative modelling and spatial inference toolbox
tools.detailed_description: A software toolbox for normative modelling of neuroimaging data, allowing researchers to map individual differences against a reference population model to make spatial inferences about brain deviations.

tools.name: PALM (Neuro)
tools.one_line_profile: Permutation Analysis of Linear Models
tools.detailed_description: A tool for rigorous statistical inference using permutation methods, capable of handling various neuroimaging data structures (volumetric, surface-based) and complex linear models, often used with FSL.

tools.name: asympPDC
tools.one_line_profile: Asymptotic Partial Directed Coherence estimation package
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB package for estimating Partial Directed Coherence (PDC) and Directed Transfer Function (DTF) with asymptotic statistics, used for analyzing effective connectivity and Granger causality in neural time series.

tools.name: BIDS App - PyMVPA
tools.one_line_profile: BIDS App for MVPA and RSA analysis
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App wrapper for the PyMVPA toolbox, enabling Multi-Variate Pattern Analysis (MVPA) and Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) on BIDS-formatted datasets via containerized execution.

tools.name: BIDS App - rs_signal_extract
tools.one_line_profile: Resting state signal extraction BIDS App
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App that uses nilearn to extract resting-state fMRI signals from BIDS datasets, facilitating functional connectivity analysis.

tools.name: BrainIAK
tools.one_line_profile: Brain Imaging Analysis Kit
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python toolkit for advanced fMRI analysis, focusing on computationally intensive methods like Intersubject Correlation (ISC), Intersubject Functional Correlation (ISFC), and Shared Response Modeling (SRM).

tools.name: BrainIAK Extras
tools.one_line_profile: Extensions for BrainIAK
tools.detailed_description: A collection of extension modules for the BrainIAK toolbox, including tools for Topological Data Analysis (TDA) and other experimental features.

tools.name: PaLM Implementation
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source implementation of Google's PaLM
tools.detailed_description: An open-source PyTorch implementation of the PaLM (Pathways Language Model) architecture, enabling research into large language models and their scaling properties.

tools.name: PyReliMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for calculating reliability metrics in MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for calculating group-level and individual-level similarity and reliability metrics (such as ICC) between MRI runs and sessions, facilitating quality control and reliability analysis in neuroimaging studies.

tools.name: mvpalab
tools.one_line_profile: Decoding toolbox for Multi-Voxel Pattern Analysis in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: An easy-to-use MATLAB toolbox designed for Multi-Voxel Pattern Analysis (MVPA) and decoding of neuroimaging data, supporting feature selection, classification, and permutation testing.

tools.name: NBS-Predict
tools.one_line_profile: Prediction-based extension of Network-Based Statistics
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox that extends Network-Based Statistics (NBS) to perform prediction-based analyses on brain connectivity networks, identifying subnetworks with high predictive power for behavioral or clinical variables.

tools.name: LiFE
tools.one_line_profile: Linear Fascicle Evaluation for tractography validation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for Linear Fascicle Evaluation (LiFE), a method to validate and score white matter connectomes generated by tractography algorithms against the original diffusion MRI data.

tools.name: mne-ari
tools.one_line_profile: All-Resolutions Inference for M/EEG in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing All-Resolutions Inference (ARI) for M/EEG data, allowing for statistically valid circular inference and selective analysis of brain activity regions.

tools.name: Med-PaLM
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of Med-PaLM, a large language model tuned for biomedical applications
tools.detailed_description: An open-source implementation of the Med-PaLM architecture, designed to answer biomedical questions and process medical text data, facilitating research in biomedical AI.

tools.name: PaLM-E
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of PaLM-E, an embodied multimodal language model
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of PaLM-E, which integrates vision and language for embodied reasoning tasks, applicable in robotics and physical simulation research.

tools.name: Nilearn
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning for NeuroImaging in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for fast and easy statistical learning on NeuroImaging data. It leverages the scikit-learn Python toolbox for multivariate statistics with applications such as predictive modeling, classification, decoding, or connectivity analysis.

tools.name: pnl_randomise
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for FSL randomise statistical inference from PNL-BWH
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and utilities to facilitate the use of FSL's randomise tool for non-parametric permutation testing in neuroimaging, developed by the Psychiatry Neuroimaging Laboratory.

tools.name: PyPermut
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for cluster-based permutation tests in statistics and machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to perform permutation tests, specifically useful for cluster-based correction in neuroimaging and time-series analysis, facilitating robust statistical inference.

tools.name: confounds
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for handling confounds and covariates in neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A library providing methods and guidance for visualizing, assessing, and removing confounds (covariates) from neuroimaging data to improve the validity of predictive modeling and statistical analysis.

tools.name: tacmagic
tools.one_line_profile: R package for PET time-activity curve analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the analysis of Positron Emission Tomography (PET) data, specifically for analyzing time-activity curves (TAC) and calculating binding potentials, backed by rOpenSci.

tools.name: rsatoolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA)
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for performing Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA), a computational technique to characterize the information representation in the brain and computational models.

tools.name: rsatoolbox_matlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA)
tools.detailed_description: The MATLAB implementation of the RSA toolbox, enabling researchers to perform representational similarity analysis on neuroimaging and behavioral data.

tools.name: SPM (Development)
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical Parametric Mapping software for neuroimaging (Dev Version)
tools.detailed_description: The development repository for SPM (Statistical Parametric Mapping), a major software package for the analysis of brain imaging data sequences (fMRI, PET, SPECT, EEG, MEG).

tools.name: SPM12
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical Parametric Mapping software (Version 12)
tools.detailed_description: The official release repository for SPM12, providing standard algorithms for the analysis of neuroimaging data, including GLM, DCM, and random field theory inference.

tools.name: SPM8
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical Parametric Mapping software (Version 8)
tools.detailed_description: Legacy release of the SPM software package (SPM8) for neuroimaging data analysis.

tools.name: MVPA-Light
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for Multi-Voxel Pattern Analysis (MVPA)
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight MATLAB toolbox for classification and regression of multi-dimensional data, specifically designed for MVPA in neuroimaging.

tools.name: TFCE_mediation
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for mediation analysis with TFCE correction
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing fast regression and mediation analysis on vertex or voxel MRI data, utilizing Threshold-Free Cluster Enhancement (TFCE) for statistical inference.

tools.name: repsim
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch library for Representational Similarity Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for measuring representational similarity between neural networks or brain data, supporting various metrics like CKA and RSA.

tools.name: DINOv2-3D-Med
tools.one_line_profile: 3D implementation of DINOv2 for self-supervised pretraining on volumetric medical images
tools.detailed_description: A library providing a 3D implementation of the DINOv2 self-supervised learning method, specifically adapted for volumetric medical imaging data. It integrates with Lightly, MONAI, and PyTorch Lightning to facilitate pretraining on 3D datasets.

tools.name: 3D-TransUNet
tools.one_line_profile: Vision Transformers for 3D medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the 3D TransUNet architecture, which combines Vision Transformers with U-Net for medical image segmentation tasks. It serves as a strong baseline and reusable model for volumetric segmentation.

tools.name: BiTr-Unet
tools.one_line_profile: CNN-Transformer Combined Network for MRI Brain Tumor Segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Source code for BiTr-Unet, a hybrid architecture combining CNNs and Transformers for efficient and accurate brain tumor segmentation in MRI images.

tools.name: HD-BM
tools.one_line_profile: Automated deep-learning based segmentation of brain metastases
tools.detailed_description: A specialized deep learning tool for the automatic segmentation of brain metastases in MRI scans, developed by the CCI Bonn group.

tools.name: HD-GLIO
tools.one_line_profile: Automated deep-learning based brain tumor segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool specifically designed for the segmentation of glioblastomas in MRI data, providing automated contouring for neuro-oncology applications.

tools.name: adell-mri
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for radiology data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for segmentation, classification, object detection, and self-supervised learning specifically tailored for radiology and MRI data.

tools.name: bfm
tools.one_line_profile: General-Purpose Brain Foundation Models for Time-Series Neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of general-purpose foundation models designed for analyzing time-series neuroimaging data (such as fMRI), enabling various downstream tasks.

tools.name: SlicerAutomatedDentalTools
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for automated dental and craniofacial analysis
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that provides automated tools for dental and craniofacial image analysis, including segmentation and landmarking.

tools.name: TotalSegmentator-AIDE
tools.one_line_profile: TotalSegmentator packaged as a MONAI AIDE Application
tools.detailed_description: A deployment of the TotalSegmentator tool packaged according to the MONAI Application Package (MAP) standard, facilitating integration into clinical AI deployment environments (AIDE).

tools.name: LDAE
tools.one_line_profile: Latent Diffusion Autoencoders for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A framework for unsupervised representation learning in 3D medical imaging using Latent Diffusion Autoencoders, enabling efficient semantic control and generation.

tools.name: TFF
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end transformer framework for analyzing 4D fMRI time-series data
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for the analysis of fMRI time-series data using Transformer architectures. It provides an end-to-end pipeline for processing 4D neuroimaging data, enabling researchers to apply attention-based deep learning models to functional magnetic resonance imaging tasks.

tools.name: LViT
tools.one_line_profile: Language-Vision Transformer for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of the LViT (Language meets Vision Transformer) model for medical image segmentation. It integrates text information with visual features to improve segmentation performance, specifically targeting semi-supervised learning scenarios in medical imaging.

tools.name: IBGNN
tools.one_line_profile: Interpretable Graph Neural Networks for connectome-based brain disorder analysis
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of an interpretable Graph Neural Network (GNN) framework for analyzing brain connectomes. It is designed to classify brain disorders while providing interpretability regarding the underlying brain network connections.

tools.name: EKAID
tools.one_line_profile: Expert Knowledge-Aware Image Difference Graph Representation Learning
tools.detailed_description: Code for a difference-aware medical visual question answering (VQA) system. It utilizes expert knowledge and graph representation learning to analyze differences in medical images, aiding in diagnostic interpretation.

tools.name: lstm_multi_modal_UNet
tools.one_line_profile: LSTM multi-modal U-Net for brain tumor segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a deep learning model combining LSTM and U-Net architectures for segmenting brain tumors from multi-modal MRI data. It captures spatial and sequence information to improve segmentation accuracy.

tools.name: MEW-UNet
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-axis representation learning in frequency domain for segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of MEW-UNet, a medical image segmentation model that leverages multi-axis representation learning in the frequency domain to capture global and local features effectively.

tools.name: VS_Seg
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Segmentation of Vestibular Schwannoma with MONAI
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool for the automatic segmentation of Vestibular Schwannoma from MRI scans, built using the MONAI framework. Developed by KCL-BMEIS, it provides a robust pipeline for this specific clinical application.

tools.name: ITKPOCUS
tools.one_line_profile: Library for streaming and preprocessing point-of-care ultrasound video
tools.detailed_description: An open-source library developed by Kitware for handling point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) video data. It supports streaming, preprocessing, and integration with ITK, facilitating the development of AI applications for ultrasound.

tools.name: MEDIAR
tools.one_line_profile: Data-Centric and Model-Centric framework for Multi-Modality Microscopy
tools.detailed_description: The winning solution for the NeurIPS 2022 CellSeg Challenge. It provides a robust framework for cell segmentation in multi-modality microscopy images, combining data-centric and model-centric approaches.

tools.name: 3DUNet-BraTS-PyTorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch 3D U-Net implementation for BraTS 2021
tools.detailed_description: A robust PyTorch implementation of the 3D U-Net architecture specifically optimized for the Multimodal Brain Tumor Segmentation (BraTS) 2021 challenge. It serves as a baseline and tool for brain tumor segmentation tasks.

tools.name: fastMONAI
tools.one_line_profile: High-level wrapper for MONAI to simplify medical deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A library that simplifies the use of MONAI (Medical Open Network for AI) by providing a high-level API similar to fastai. It facilitates rapid development and training of deep learning models for medical imaging.

tools.name: mindGlide
tools.one_line_profile: Brain Segmentation with MONAI and Dynamic Unet
tools.detailed_description: A tool for brain segmentation leveraging MONAI and Dynamic U-Net architectures. It provides a streamlined approach for segmenting brain structures from MRI data.

tools.name: Pytorch-Medical-Segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of PyTorch implementations for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive repository containing implementations of various state-of-the-art deep learning models for medical image segmentation in both 2D and 3D. It serves as a library/reference for applying these models to new datasets.

tools.name: monai-cloud-api
tools.one_line_profile: Client library for MONAI Cloud API
tools.detailed_description: The official client library and development tools for the MONAI Cloud API, enabling integration of MONAI's intelligent imaging and learning tools into cloud-based workflows and services.

tools.name: CNN_design_for_AD
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for early Alzheimer’s disease detection
tools.detailed_description: Code for a generalizable deep learning model designed for the early detection of Alzheimer’s disease from structural MRI scans. Developed by NYU MedML, it provides a robust solver for this diagnostic task.

tools.name: MobileUNETR
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight hybrid Vision Transformer for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight end-to-end hybrid Vision Transformer (ViT) designed for efficient medical image segmentation, offering a balance between performance and computational cost.

tools.name: MedViT
tools.one_line_profile: Robust Vision Transformer for generalized medical image classification
tools.detailed_description: A robust Vision Transformer architecture tailored for medical image classification tasks, addressing generalization challenges in healthcare imaging data.

tools.name: MONAI Generative Models
tools.one_line_profile: Generative models framework for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A library within the MONAI ecosystem dedicated to training, evaluating, and deploying generative models (GANs, Diffusion Models) for medical imaging applications.

tools.name: MONAI
tools.one_line_profile: AI Toolkit for Healthcare Imaging
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive, community-supported, PyTorch-based framework for deep learning in healthcare imaging, providing domain-optimized foundational capabilities for data loading, preprocessing, and model training.

tools.name: MONAI Label
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent open source image labeling and learning tool
tools.detailed_description: A server-client system that facilitates AI-assisted annotation of medical imaging data, integrating with viewers like 3D Slicer and OHIF to accelerate dataset creation.

tools.name: SlicerMONAIViz
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for MONAI model visualization
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that enables visualization and interaction with MONAI models and their outputs directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: VISTA
tools.one_line_profile: Versatile Imaging Segmentation and Annotation foundation model
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model framework for versatile medical image segmentation and annotation, designed to handle diverse segmentation tasks across different modalities.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for deploying medical AI applications
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to become the standard for developing, packaging, testing, and running medical AI applications in clinical production environments.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy App SDK
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for developing AI-driven healthcare imaging applications
tools.detailed_description: A software development kit providing tools and interfaces to design, develop, and verify AI applications (MAPs) for healthcare imaging.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy Informatics Gateway
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM integration and data ingestion service
tools.detailed_description: A service that facilitates integration with DICOM systems, enabling ingestion of imaging data and triggering of AI workflows in clinical settings.

tools.name: DeepNeuro
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning python package for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing deep learning tools specifically for neuroimaging data analysis, including preprocessing and segmentation utilities.

tools.name: PRIOR
tools.one_line_profile: Prototype Representation Joint Learning from Medical Images and Reports
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a method for joint learning from medical images and reports using prototype representations, useful for multi-modal medical AI research.

tools.name: RAUNet
tools.one_line_profile: Residual Attention U-Net for tumor segmentation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Residual Attention U-Net architecture specifically designed for tumor segmentation in liver and brain MRI images.

tools.name: EViT-Unet
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Vision Transformer for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A U-Net like Efficient Vision Transformer model designed for medical image segmentation, optimized for mobile and edge devices.

tools.name: TorchIO
tools.one_line_profile: Medical imaging processing for AI applications
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for efficient loading, preprocessing, augmentation, and patch-based sampling of 3D medical images for deep learning.

tools.name: SwiFT
tools.one_line_profile: Swin 4D fMRI Transformer
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Swin Transformer-based model for analyzing 4D fMRI data, enabling advanced functional connectivity studies.

tools.name: Generative Brain ControlNet
tools.one_line_profile: ControlNet training on Brain data using MONAI
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing implementations for training ControlNet models on brain MRI data (UK Biobank) using the MONAI Generative Models framework.

tools.name: Generative Chest X-ray
tools.one_line_profile: Latent Diffusion Models for Chest X-ray
tools.detailed_description: A repository for training Latent Diffusion Models on Chest X-ray data using MONAI, serving as a reference implementation for medical image generation.

tools.name: Generative MONAI
tools.one_line_profile: Generative AI extension for the MONAI medical imaging framework
tools.detailed_description: A dedicated extension of the MONAI framework focused on generative models for medical imaging, enabling tasks such as image synthesis, translation, and augmentation using state-of-the-art diffusion and GAN-based approaches.

tools.name: FLARE22 Champion Solution
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient 3D medical image segmentation solution based on nnU-Net
tools.detailed_description: The champion solution for the MICCAI FLARE22 challenge, providing a highly optimized and efficient implementation of nnU-Net for 3D abdominal organ segmentation, serving as a strong baseline and solver for similar volumetric segmentation tasks.

tools.name: im2im-uq
tools.one_line_profile: Image-to-image regression with distribution-free uncertainty quantification
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library for performing image-to-image regression tasks with rigorous, distribution-free uncertainty quantification, applicable to scientific imaging tasks like reconstruction and denoising where reliability is critical.

tools.name: BrainDiVE
tools.one_line_profile: Brain diffusion model for cortical discovery and visual exploration
tools.detailed_description: A generative model framework leveraging diffusion models to explore and visualize cortical patterns, enabling the discovery of brain surface features and synthesis of neuroimaging data.

tools.name: ClinicaDL
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible deep learning processing of neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software framework for reproducible clinical neuroimaging analysis using deep learning, providing workflows for data preprocessing, classification, reconstruction, and interpretation of MRI and PET data.

tools.name: Context-Aware SSL
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based self-supervised representation learning for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of a context-aware self-supervised learning framework that utilizes graph structures to learn robust representations from medical images, improving downstream analysis tasks.

tools.name: Synthetic Sleep EEG Diffusion
tools.one_line_profile: Latent diffusion models for synthetic sleep EEG signal generation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool utilizing latent diffusion models to generate high-fidelity synthetic sleep EEG signals, aiding in data augmentation and model training for sleep analysis.

tools.name: DNNWSP
tools.one_line_profile: Deep neural network with weight sparsity control for brain connectivity classification
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning solver implementing L1-norm regularization (weight sparsity) to improve classification performance on whole-brain resting-state functional connectivity patterns, specifically for schizophrenia diagnosis.

tools.name: Self-Supervised MRI Reconstruction
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel network training framework for self-supervised MRI reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A self-supervised learning framework for MRI reconstruction that employs a parallel network training strategy to achieve high-quality image reconstruction without fully sampled ground truth.

tools.name: ViT-AE++
tools.one_line_profile: Improved Vision Transformer Autoencoder for medical image representation learning
tools.detailed_description: An advanced Vision Transformer Autoencoder (ViT-AE) architecture designed to learn robust and transferable self-supervised representations from medical images.

tools.name: ASCENT
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for cardiac ultrasound segmentation and color-Doppler dealiasing
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive toolbox for cardiac ultrasound analysis, providing tools for segmentation and color-Doppler dealiasing, supporting advanced cardiovascular imaging research.

tools.name: C2FViT
tools.one_line_profile: Affine medical image registration using Coarse-to-Fine Vision Transformer
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning solver for affine medical image registration that utilizes a Coarse-to-Fine Vision Transformer architecture to achieve robust and accurate alignment of 3D medical images.

tools.name: SlicerTorchIO
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer module for TorchIO medical image processing
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Slicer extension that integrates TorchIO, enabling advanced medical image augmentation and preprocessing directly within the Slicer environment.

tools.name: ResViT
tools.one_line_profile: Residual Vision Transformers for multi-modal medical image synthesis
tools.detailed_description: A generative adversarial network (GAN) based on vision transformers for synthesizing medical images (e.g., MRI to CT) with high fidelity.

tools.name: deepbrain
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for brain extraction and processing
tools.detailed_description: A specialized library providing deep learning-based tools for brain extraction (skull stripping) from MRI images, packaged for easy use.

tools.name: SlicerMONAIAuto3DSeg
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for MONAI Auto3DSeg models
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that enables users to run MONAI's Auto3DSeg automated segmentation models directly within the Slicer interface.

tools.name: GLoRIA
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal global-local representation learning for medical image recognition
tools.detailed_description: A framework for learning global and local representations from multimodal medical data (images and text), serving as a foundation model for various downstream medical recognition tasks.

tools.name: NoBrainer
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for developing 3D neuroimaging neural network models
tools.detailed_description: A framework based on TensorFlow/Keras for developing and training 3D neural network models specifically for neuroimaging data processing, including segmentation and regression tasks.

tools.name: NoBrainer Zoo
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for pre-trained deep learning models in neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface and collection of pre-trained deep learning models for 3D brain MRI processing tasks such as brain extraction and segmentation, facilitating easy inference.

tools.name: Patch-based 3D U-Net (brats17)
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of patch-based 3D U-Net for brain tumor segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning implementation for volumetric segmentation of brain tumors using a patch-based 3D U-Net architecture, specifically designed for the BraTS challenge dataset.

tools.name: BrainGNN
tools.one_line_profile: Graph Neural Network for fMRI analysis and brain network representation
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of BrainGNN, a graph neural network framework designed to analyze functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) data by modeling brain regions as nodes and their connections as edges for classification and biomarker identification.

tools.name: U-Net Brain Tumor Segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for brain tumor segmentation using U-Net
tools.detailed_description: A widely used implementation of the U-Net architecture for segmenting brain tumors from MRI data. It serves as a reference baseline and practical solver for medical image segmentation tasks.

tools.name: AlizaMS
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer with 2D and 3D visualization capabilities
tools.detailed_description: AlizaMS is a DICOM viewer that supports 2D and 3D visualization of medical images. It provides tools for viewing DICOM files from various modalities and includes features for basic image manipulation and analysis.

tools.name: ecg-dicom-web-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based viewer for ECG data in DICOM format
tools.detailed_description: A TypeScript library that enables the rendering and viewing of Electrocardiogram (ECG) files in DICOM format directly within a web browser using HTML5 canvas.

tools.name: Homer3
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB application for fNIRS data processing and visualization
tools.detailed_description: Homer3 is an open-source MATLAB application designed for the analysis and visualization of functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (fNIRS) data. It provides a GUI for processing streams and viewing results.

tools.name: BioExplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization tool for large-scale scientific data
tools.detailed_description: The Blue Brain BioExplorer is a tool designed for scientists to extract and analyze scientific data through visualization and interactive exploration, supporting large-scale biological simulations.

tools.name: OHIF-AI
tools.one_line_profile: OHIF DICOM viewer integrated with server-side AI segmentation models
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the OHIF DICOM Web viewer that integrates server-side AI models (such as SAM2, medSAM2) to enable advanced segmentation and annotation workflows directly within the viewer.

tools.name: NeuroCave
tools.one_line_profile: Immersive visual analytics tool for exploring the human connectome
tools.detailed_description: NeuroCave is a web-based visual analytics tool that facilitates the exploration of human connectome data in group studies, supporting immersive visualization for complex brain network analysis.

tools.name: DICOMweb-js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript client library for consuming DICOM Web Services
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript client library designed to interface with DICOM Web Services (QIDO-RS, WADO-RS, STOW-RS), enabling web-based medical imaging applications to query and retrieve DICOM data.

tools.name: Visbrain
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated suite for brain data visualization
tools.detailed_description: Visbrain is a Python-based, GPU-accelerated open-source suite designed for the visualization of various brain data modalities, including EEG, intracranial signals, and brain connectivity.

tools.name: Asclepios DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop DICOM viewer built with C++, Qt, and VTK
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive DICOM viewer application developed using C++, Qt, and VTK, supporting the visualization and inspection of medical imaging data.

tools.name: DICOMweb WSI Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Whole slide imaging viewer for Google Cloud Healthcare DICOM API
tools.detailed_description: A proof-of-concept web viewer for Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) data, designed to interface with the Google Cloud Healthcare DICOM API for visualizing digital pathology slides.

tools.name: dicom-microscopy-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based library for viewing DICOM slide microscopy
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for visualizing DICOM Whole Slide Imaging (WSI) data in web browsers, developed by the Imaging Data Commons.

tools.name: SLIM
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM slide microscopy viewer and annotation tool
tools.detailed_description: SLIM is an interoperable, web-based viewer for DICOM slide microscopy that includes tools for annotation, supporting digital pathology workflows.

tools.name: jsdicom
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript DICOM library and viewer
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library and viewer for parsing and displaying DICOM files in web applications.

tools.name: simpleITK-Snap
tools.one_line_profile: Qt-based 3D data visualization tool wrapping SimpleITK
tools.detailed_description: A 3D data visualization tool built with Python and Qt, serving as a lightweight wrapper around SimpleITK for medical image viewing and analysis.

tools.name: VolView
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D radiological viewer for DICOM data
tools.detailed_description: VolView is an open-source, web-based radiological viewer that supports DICOM loading, volume rendering, and annotations directly in the browser, emphasizing data privacy.

tools.name: Kitware ImageViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight cross-platform 2D/3D medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, cross-platform application for viewing 2D and 3D medical images, developed by Kitware.

tools.name: ConnectomeViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for multi-modal neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python application for the visualization and analysis of multi-modal, multi-scale network and neuroimaging data, facilitating connectomics research.

tools.name: DicomVis
tools.one_line_profile: Simple 4-pane DICOM series viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python application using VTK for visualizing series of DICOM images in a standard 4-pane layout.

tools.name: PhantomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis package for MRI phantoms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed for analyzing MRI phantoms, supporting quality control and standardization efforts by NIST and collaborators.

tools.name: NeuroMorph
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for neuronal morphology analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: NeuroMorph is a toolkit designed for the analysis and visualization of neuronal morphology, providing capabilities to manipulate and inspect neuron structures.

tools.name: OHIF Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible, web-based medical imaging platform
tools.detailed_description: The OHIF Viewer is a zero-footprint, web-based medical imaging platform that supports DICOM viewing, segmentation, and extension for various oncology and radiology workflows.

tools.name: Connectome Workbench
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization and analysis tool for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A visualization and analysis tool developed by the Human Connectome Project (HCP). It specializes in handling surface and volume data, allowing for the exploration of brain connectivity and cortical structure.

tools.name: seeVieweR
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB-based 3D viewer for NIfTI images
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight 3D viewer for NIfTI neuroimaging data built in MATLAB, designed for quick visualization and inspection of brain images.

tools.name: CVU
tools.one_line_profile: Connectome Visualization Utility
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based utility for visualizing connectome data, facilitating the exploration of brain network connectivity matrices and graphs.

tools.name: nbpapaya
tools.one_line_profile: Papaya.js viewer integration for Jupyter Notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables the embedding of the Papaya medical image viewer directly into Jupyter Notebooks, facilitating interactive visualization within data analysis workflows.

tools.name: brainSurfer
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for surface-based brain data visualization
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox designed to visualize neuroimaging data on brain surfaces, supporting various mapping and display options for cortical analysis.

tools.name: vscode-neuro-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroimaging viewer extension for VS Code
tools.detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that allows researchers to visualize and inspect neuroimaging data (NIfTI, etc.) directly within the code editor environment.

tools.name: pydcmview
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, terminal-based viewer for DICOM, NRRD, and NIfTI images, enabling quick inspection of medical imaging data in command-line environments.

tools.name: Nextcloud DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer integration for Nextcloud
tools.detailed_description: An application for Nextcloud that allows users to view and analyze DICOM medical images directly within the Nextcloud web interface, facilitating secure data sharing and review.

tools.name: dicompyler
tools.one_line_profile: Radiation therapy research platform and DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: An extensible open-source platform for radiation therapy research and a viewer for DICOM and DICOM RT data. It supports visualization of dose distributions and structures.

tools.name: Rocket Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Generic viewer for medical images and biological data
tools.detailed_description: A versatile web-based viewer designed to visualize various types of biomedical data, including medical images, 3D surfaces, and electrophysiological signals.

tools.name: BioImage Suite Web
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based medical image analysis suite
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web-based medical image analysis suite that runs in the browser. It offers tools for visualization, registration, segmentation, and connectivity analysis.

tools.name: DyNeuSR
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamical Neuroimaging Spatiotemporal Representations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for visualizing and analyzing spatiotemporal patterns in neuroimaging data, focusing on dynamical representations of brain activity.

tools.name: brainrender
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for 3D neuroanatomical visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for creating high-quality 3D renderings of neuroanatomical data, registered to reference atlases (e.g., Allen Brain Atlas). It facilitates the visualization of brain structures and experimental data.

tools.name: brainsprite
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D brain slice viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight tool that turns a sprite of brain slices into an interactive 3D web viewer, allowing for easy embedding of brain visualizations in web pages.

tools.name: eegtools
tools.one_line_profile: Python modules for EEG analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python modules for EEG data analysis, including tools for loading data formats (EDF+, BDF), plotting scalp maps, and applying spatial filters.

tools.name: QIT
tools.one_line_profile: Quantitative Imaging Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for the visualization, processing, and analysis of neuroimaging datasets, with a focus on diffusion MRI and structural connectivity.

tools.name: headjack
tools.one_line_profile: Terminal-based interactive NIfTI viewer
tools.detailed_description: A command-line interface tool written in Rust for viewing NIfTI neuroimaging files directly in the terminal. It provides a lightweight, keyboard-driven interface for quick inspection of volumetric brain data without the need for a graphical desktop environment.

tools.name: StudyCentric
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based research DICOM viewer for clinical study management
tools.detailed_description: A research-focused DICOM viewer developed by the Department of Biomedical and Health Informatics at CHOP. It is designed to facilitate the visualization and review of medical imaging data within the context of clinical research studies.

tools.name: eegUtils
tools.one_line_profile: R package for processing and visualizing EEG data
tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a collection of utilities for the processing, analysis, and visualization of electroencephalography (EEG) data. It includes functions for data import, preprocessing, and generating topographical plots.

tools.name: BlueLight
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight browser-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A pure JavaScript DICOM viewer that runs in the browser, supporting various medical imaging modalities. It aims to provide a lightweight, zero-footprint solution for viewing medical images without server-side rendering.

tools.name: nii-masker
tools.one_line_profile: CLI wrapper for Nilearn masking operations
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool that wraps Nilearn's Masker objects, allowing users to extract time-series signals from NIfTI images using regions of interest (ROIs) or masks without writing Python scripts.

tools.name: Databricks Pixels
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable processing and visualization framework for medical images
tools.detailed_description: A solution accelerator by Databricks for large-scale processing of medical images (DICOM) and documents. It integrates the OHIF Viewer and segmentation models to facilitate interactive learning and data management in a lakehouse architecture.

tools.name: brainview
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for 3D brain morphometry visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library based on Matplotlib and Mayavi for visualizing morphometric data on 3D brain meshes. It provides tools to map statistical maps or anatomical data onto cortical surfaces.

tools.name: threeBrain
tools.one_line_profile: R package for interactive 3D brain visualization
tools.detailed_description: An R package that uses Three.js to create interactive 3D visualizations of brain MRI and intracranial electrode data. It is particularly useful for visualizing electrode localization and functional data in a web-compatible format.

tools.name: ecog_fmri_visualization_matlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for ECoG and fMRI visualization
tools.detailed_description: A set of MATLAB functions designed for the flexible plotting of intracranial EEG (ECoG) electrodes and fMRI statistical maps onto 3D brain models. It supports custom visualization of multimodal neuroimaging data.

tools.name: NIfTI-Studio
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for NIfTI visualization and editing
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolbox for viewing, editing, and 3D rendering of medical images in NIfTI and Analyze formats. It provides a graphical interface for inspecting volumetric data and performing basic manipulations.

tools.name: MRI Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance web-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool developed by EPAM for advanced 2D and 3D visualization of medical images (MRI/CT). It supports volume rendering, isosurfaces, and multi-planar reconstruction in the browser.

tools.name: fhlin_toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for multimodal neuroimaging analysis
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB routines for processing and visualizing fMRI, EEG, and MEG data. It includes interfaces for working with FreeSurfer data and performing inverse problem calculations.

tools.name: 3DCurator
tools.one_line_profile: 3D viewer for CT scans of cultural heritage objects
tools.detailed_description: A specialized 3D viewer designed for analyzing CT scans of polychromed wood sculptures. It aids in the conservation science domain by allowing detailed inspection of internal structures and layers of heritage artifacts.

tools.name: brainplotlib
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Python package for brain surface plotting
tools.detailed_description: A Python package focused on plotting brain surface data. It provides a simple interface for visualizing cortical maps and neuroimaging results on standard brain meshes.

tools.name: dicomViewerLib
tools.one_line_profile: Angular component for DICOM visualization
tools.detailed_description: A reusable Angular library for displaying DICOM images in web applications. It provides components for basic medical image viewing and manipulation within the Angular framework.

tools.name: FreeBrowse
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based neuroimaging viewer based on FreeView
tools.detailed_description: A web-based implementation of the FreeView visualization tool, built on top of NiiVue. It allows users to visualize FreeSurfer outputs and other neuroimaging data directly in a web browser.

tools.name: dicomgraphics
tools.one_line_profile: Go-based DICOM viewer and graphics utility
tools.detailed_description: An open-source application and library written in Go for viewing and manipulating DICOM graphics. It leverages the Fyne toolkit to provide a cross-platform interface for medical image inspection.

tools.name: pycortex
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for fMRI surface visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for visualizing fMRI data on cortical surfaces. It creates interactive WebGL-based 3D viewers that allow for the exploration of functional maps projected onto brain geometry.

tools.name: Ginkgo CADx
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced open-source DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform DICOM viewer that provides advanced features for medical image visualization, including MPR (Multi-Planar Reconstruction), DICOMization of other formats, and PACS integration.

tools.name: colormap_to_ITKSNAP
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to convert Matplotlib colormaps to ITK-SNAP format
tools.detailed_description: A Python script that facilitates the transfer of colormaps from Matplotlib to the ITK-SNAP segmentation software, enhancing the visualization customization options for neuroimaging data.

tools.name: HTML5 Dicom Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer using HTML5
tools.detailed_description: A Java-backed HTML5 application for viewing DICOM images in a web browser. It provides basic functionality for displaying medical images without requiring client-side installation.

tools.name: embedded-pydicom-react-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based DICOM viewer using Pyodide and React
tools.detailed_description: A web-based DICOM viewer that runs Python code in the browser via Pyodide/WebAssembly. It utilizes pydicom for parsing and React for the UI, demonstrating a serverless approach to medical image analysis.

tools.name: Niivue
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL2-based NIfTI volume viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, zero-footprint WebGL2 component for visualizing NIfTI and other neuroimaging volume formats in the browser. It is designed to be embedded in web applications for fast and interactive 3D rendering.

tools.name: MedicalViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Qt-based 2D/3D DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for 2D and 3D visualization of DICOM images, built using Qt, ITK, and VTK. It supports multi-view display and basic image processing functions.

tools.name: NgDicomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Angular application for DICOM viewing
tools.detailed_description: A web application built with Angular for viewing DICOM images. It provides a user interface for browsing and inspecting medical imaging data in a web environment.

tools.name: zViewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer based on DCMTK and OpenGL
tools.detailed_description: A desktop DICOM viewer application developed using DCMTK for DICOM handling and OpenGL for rendering. It includes PACS functionality and features for reading and displaying medical films.

tools.name: DWV
tools.one_line_profile: Zero-footprint DICOM Web Viewer library
tools.detailed_description: An open-source JavaScript library for viewing DICOM images in web browsers without plugins. It supports various DICOM modalities and provides tools for windowing, zooming, and drawing annotations.

tools.name: pydiq
tools.one_line_profile: Simple open-source DICOM browser and viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight DICOM viewer written in Python using PyQt, allowing users to browse and view DICOM files easily.

tools.name: medview
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based medical DICOM image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A medical image viewer built with HTML5 and JavaScript, supporting DICOM format visualization directly in the browser.

tools.name: rustymind
tools.one_line_profile: Driver and real-time plotter for NeuroSky MindWave EEG headset
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based driver, parser, and real-time brainwave plotter for the NeuroSky MindWave EEG headset, enabling data acquisition and visualization.

tools.name: DicomViewer
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM image viewer for iPad
tools.detailed_description: A native iOS application for viewing DICOM medical images on iPad devices.

tools.name: dicomweb-proxy
tools.one_line_profile: Proxy service for DICOMweb to DIMSE translation
tools.detailed_description: A proxy server that translates between modern DICOMweb (RESTful) and traditional DICOM DIMSE services, facilitating PACS communication and integration.

tools.name: EEGEdu
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive browser-based EEG visualization and education platform
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform for interactive EEG tutorials and real-time visualization using WebBluetooth and Muse devices, designed for education and experimentation.

tools.name: VoxelViz
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive fMRI data visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for fMRI datasets built using Plotly Dash, allowing for interactive exploration of voxel-wise data.

tools.name: dicom-ecg-plot
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM ECG Viewer and Converter
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to view and convert DICOM ECG files into various formats like PDF, PNG, JPG, and SVG.

tools.name: WizardHat
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time BCI data processing and plotting tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for real-time processing and plotting of data streamed over Lab Streaming Layer (LSL), specifically designed for student-led Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) projects.

tools.name: webDICOM
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web application for viewing DICOM medical images directly in the browser.

tools.name: dicom.el
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM viewer for Emacs
tools.detailed_description: A DICOM viewer extension for the Emacs text editor, allowing users to view medical images within the Emacs environment.

tools.name: ipyniivue
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter Widget for NiiVue medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A WebGL-powered Jupyter Widget that integrates the NiiVue medical image viewer into Jupyter notebooks, enabling interactive neuroimaging visualization within Python environments.

tools.name: NiiVue
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL2-based medical image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, WebGL2-based medical image viewer component that supports over 30 formats of volumes and meshes, designed for integration into web applications.

tools.name: NiiVue VSCode
tools.one_line_profile: VS Code extension for NiiVue to visualize medical images directly in the editor
tools.detailed_description: A Visual Studio Code extension that integrates NiiVue, allowing researchers and developers to visualize NIfTI and other medical image formats directly within their development environment.

tools.name: NiReports
tools.one_line_profile: Reporting and visualization system for neuroimaging preprocessing pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating visual reports for neuroimaging processing pipelines, providing quality control visualizations and reportlets for tools like fMRIPrep.

tools.name: PySurfer
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for visualizing cortical surface neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for visualizing cortical surface representations of neuroimaging data. It extends Mayavi to provide a high-level interface for working with FreeSurfer data.

tools.name: Weasis
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A multipurpose web-based DICOM viewer with a highly modular architecture. It allows integration with PACS and supports various medical imaging formats for clinical and research visualization.

tools.name: FSLeyes
tools.one_line_profile: The FSL image viewer for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: FSLeyes is a powerful and versatile image viewer for displaying NIfTI images, surface meshes, and other neuroimaging data formats. It is the standard viewer for the FSL software library.

tools.name: MMVT
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-Modality Visualization Tool for neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for researchers to visualize and explore neuroimaging anatomical and spatio-temporal data, supporting multiple modalities including fMRI, MEG, and EEG.

tools.name: Aeskulap
tools.one_line_profile: Medical image viewer and DICOM network client
tools.detailed_description: An open-source medical image viewer capable of loading a series of special images stored in DICOM format for review. It also supports querying and fetching data from PACS.

tools.name: OsiriX
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced open-source DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: An image processing software dedicated to DICOM images produced by medical equipment (MRI, CT, PET, PET-CT, etc.). It offers advanced 2D and 3D visualization techniques.

tools.name: ITK-SNAP
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive software for medical image segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A software application used to segment structures in 3D medical images. It provides semi-automatic segmentation using active contour methods, as well as manual delineation and image navigation.

tools.name: Papaya
tools.one_line_profile: Pure JavaScript medical research image viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, pure JavaScript medical image viewer that runs in the browser. It supports NIfTI and DICOM formats and is widely used for embedding neuroimaging visualization in web applications.

tools.name: MRIcroWeb
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL-based NIfTI volume rendering viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based version of MRIcroGL that uses WebGL to provide volume rendering of NIfTI images directly in the browser.

tools.name: dcm2niix
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to NIfTI converter
tools.detailed_description: A robust tool for converting medical images from DICOM format to NIfTI format. It is a critical component in many neuroimaging processing pipelines.

tools.name: eeg_positions
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to compute and plot standard EEG electrode positions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for computing and plotting standard EEG electrode positions (e.g., 10-20 system), useful for sensor layout visualization and analysis.

tools.name: dmri-explorer
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time diffusion MRI viewer
tools.detailed_description: A real-time visualization tool for diffusion MRI (dMRI) data, developed by the SCILUS lab. It supports visualization of tractography and other dMRI derived data.

tools.name: Cerebro Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic 3D viewer for brain and neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based 3D viewer designed to visualize brain models and neuroimaging data. It provides a programmatic interface for creating high-quality brain visualizations.

tools.name: Starviewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform open source medical imaging software
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform medical imaging workstation and viewer. It supports DICOM and other formats, offering tools for 2D and 3D visualization and image analysis.

tools.name: imtool3D_td
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Image Viewer with ROI tools for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based 3D image viewer that includes tools for manual segmentation and Region of Interest (ROI) analysis, supporting NIfTI and other formats.

tools.name: dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: 3D medical dataset viewer
tools.detailed_description: A C# application for viewing medical datasets in 3D, supporting DICOM files and providing volume rendering capabilities.

tools.name: VR-DICOM-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: VR viewer for interacting with DICOM data
tools.detailed_description: A Virtual Reality application designed for viewing and interacting with DICOM data, such as CT scans, in an immersive 3D environment.

tools.name: arrayShow
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB viewer for multidimensional complex data including MRI images
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab-based image viewer designed for browsing and visualizing multidimensional complex data, specifically tailored for MRI reconstruction and analysis workflows.

tools.name: UnfoldMakie.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tools for EEG data and regression ERP models in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing plotting and visualization capabilities for EEG data, specifically designed to work with Unfold.jl for regression-based Event-Related Potential (ERP) analysis. It leverages Makie.jl for high-performance graphics.

tools.name: neuroskymindwavecapture
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to capture and plot raw EEG data from NeuroSky Mindwave headsets
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility for interfacing with NeuroSky Mindwave headsets to capture, record, and plot raw EEG data, facilitating low-cost BCI research and data acquisition.

tools.name: u-dicom-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, web-based DICOM viewer that allows users to view medical imaging data directly in a browser on various devices, supporting standard DICOM formats.

tools.name: Dicom-Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Python application for displaying 2D and 3D DICOM images
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application built with Python for loading, viewing, and interacting with 2D and 3D DICOM medical images, suitable for basic medical image inspection.

tools.name: netplotbrain
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualization package for brain networks and connectivity
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to create publication-quality 3D visualizations of brain networks (nodes and edges) projected onto brain surface atlases.

tools.name: roodmri
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning benchmarking platform for out-of-distribution data in MRI
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking platform designed to evaluate the performance of deep learning models on out-of-distribution (OOD) MRI data, facilitating robust model assessment.

tools.name: ancp-bids
tools.one_line_profile: Python package to read, write, query, and validate BIDS datasets
tools.detailed_description: A library providing functionality to handle Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) datasets, including reading, writing, querying, and validation capabilities.

tools.name: APPIAN
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for analyzing PET images in conjunction with MRI
tools.detailed_description: An open-source automated software pipeline designed to facilitate the analysis of PET tracer kinetic data in conjunction with MRI, aiming for reproducibility and ease of use.

tools.name: niCHART
tools.one_line_profile: Neuro-imaging brain aging chart for structural and functional MRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive solution for analyzing standard structural and functional brain MRI data, implementing computational morphometry, signal analysis, quality control, and harmonization.

tools.name: conp-dataset
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad dataset for the Canadian Open Neuroscience Platform
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad dataset configuration for the Canadian Open Neuroscience Platform (CONP), facilitating access and management of neuroimaging data.

tools.name: UMM_ACR_QE
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab package for analysis of ACR quality control phantom MRI
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab package designed to analyze MRI scans of the ACR quality control phantom, automating the assessment of scanner performance metrics.

tools.name: MRIquality
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for routine MRI data quality assurance and control
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools for performing routine quality assurance and post-acquisition quality control on MRI data.

tools.name: abcd-dicom2bids
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for downloading and converting ABCD data to BIDS with QC
tools.detailed_description: A utility for selectively downloading QC-passed ABCD data, converting it to BIDS standard, and handling field map selection and metadata correction.

tools.name: pyfMRIqc
tools.one_line_profile: Quality check calculator for functional MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that calculates and provides metrics for the quality assessment of functional MRI (fMRI) data.

tools.name: raiders_data
tools.one_line_profile: fMRI dataset from naturalistic audio/video stimulation
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad-managed fMRI dataset containing responses to the movie 'Raiders of the Lost Ark', useful for benchmarking and analysis.

tools.name: micapipe
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal imaging and connectome analysis pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A processing pipeline for multimodal imaging and connectome analysis, integrating various neuroimaging tools.

tools.name: automatic-quality-control
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-supervised MRI quality control system
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a semi-supervised quality control system for MRI, trained using physics-based artefact generators and adversarial training.

tools.name: neurodocker
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for custom Docker and Singularity images in neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool to generate custom Docker and Singularity images for neuroimaging and neuroscience, facilitating reproducible environments.

tools.name: reproserver
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for reproducing ReproZip packages in the cloud
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform that allows users to upload and reproduce experiments packed with ReproZip in a cloud environment.

tools.name: reprozip
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating reproducible experiments from command-line executions
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the process of creating reproducible experiments by packing all necessary files and dependencies from command-line executions.

tools.name: VersionClimber
tools.one_line_profile: System for package evolution and version management in Data Science
tools.detailed_description: A system designed to handle package evolution and versioning issues specifically for Data Science workflows, aiding in reproducibility.

tools.name: BayesianQuickNAT
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian QuickNAT for MRI segmentation and uncertainty-based QC
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Bayesian QuickNAT for whole-brain MRI segmentation, providing structure-wise uncertainty estimates for quality control.

tools.name: quickNAT_pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of QuickNAT for MRI segmentation and QC
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch framework for fast brain MRI segmentation (QuickNAT and Bayesian QuickNAT) including segmentation quality control using uncertainty.

tools.name: SSSR_PET
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised super-resolution technique for PET images
tools.detailed_description: A self-supervised super-resolution (SSSR) deep learning model for PET imaging, using MRI guidance to improve image quality without paired training data.

tools.name: MRI-QA
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for MRI quality assessment
tools.detailed_description: A Convolutional Neural Network based model for automated quality assessment of 3D MRI volumes.

tools.name: niak
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for preprocessing fMRI and structural MRI scans
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App pipeline for the preprocessing of functional and structural MRI data.

tools.name: bids-validator
